description: A test activity for the responsive layout.
name: Interactive Sizing Demo

embeddable.content: This table provides a summary of the behaviors demonstrated on the following pages.

The page layout is set to "Responsive". The LARA Interactive aspect ratio is set to "use all available space".

With these settings the interactive will be sized as large as possible but still the whole interactive can be seen. The interactive should always be pinned. This demo interactive reports its actual width and height along with its actual aspect ratio.

You should resize your window to see how the interactive changes its size depending on the size of the window.

With the "use al available space" setting, if the interactive requests its own aspect ratio, it will be ignored.

The interactive can also request to be a specific height. In this case the interactive width will be as wide as possible and the height will be the requested height.

The page layout is "Responsive". The interactive on this page has an aspect ratio of "Manually set the aspect ratio".  And the value is set to 576x435

With these settings LARA will always keep the interactive aspect ratio (width/height) the same. If the page is wide and short, like the screen of a chromebook, then the interactive will be taller than the available space for it. When this happens the interactive will scroll with the page.

If the interactive height is shorter than the available space then the interactive will be 'pinned' and will stay fixed as the questions scroll by it.

Try making your window tall and narrow and then scroll the page, you should see the interactive stay in a fixed place. Now make your window wide the interactive will jump to the top of the page and scroll by as you scroll the page.

The interactive can also request to be a specific height. In this case the interactive width will be as wide as possible and the height will be the requested height.

The page layout is "Responsive". The interactive on this page has an aspect ratio setting of "Default aspect ratio, ...".  

With this setting LARA will always keep the interactive aspect ratio (width/height) the same. The default aspect ratio is about 1.32. Try making your window narrow and tall, and short and wide to see how the interactive size changes.

With this setting LARA will limit both the width and height of the interactive so it is never bigger than what will fit in the visible interactive area of the page.  In otherwords LARA will make sure the interactive is small enough to be fully visible. This is similiar to what the "use all available space" aspect ratio does, but in this case the aspect ratio of the interactive is preserved. The height limiting in this mode is different than than what happens in the "manual..." aspect ratio mode.

So if the window is short and wide, then LARA will limit the width of the interactive and you will see a white area to the right of the interactive. If the window is realy tall, then LARA will limit the height of the interactive so you will see a white area below the interactive.

Because of these height and width limits, the interactive will be pinned when scrolling the page.

The interactive can also request to be a specific height. In this case the interactive width will be as wide as possible and the height will be the requested height.

pages.name: Full Width: Default aspect ratio, Interactive Box

embeddable.content:
The page layout is "Full Width".

The interactive on this page has an aspect ratio setting of "Default aspect ratio, ...".    And the interactive has been added to the Interactive Box section of the page.

With this setting LARA will always keep the interactive aspect ratio (width/height) the same. The default aspect ratio is about 1.32. 

Just like in the other layouts, when the interactive aspect ratio setting is "Default aspect ratio, ...", LARA will limit the height of the interactive to the height of the window.  This way a student can see the whole interactive at the same time.  Most LARA themes have a full width size of 936 pixels.  So if the window is tall enough then the interactive will have a size of 936px by 707px.  If the window has less than 707px then the height of the interactive will be reduced to match the window height and the width will be adjusted so the aspect ratio stays the same. These calcuations now happen as the window is resized so you can experiment with them by resizing your browser window. 

There is no pinning of interactives in Full Width layout. This is a difference from when the "Default aspect ratio, ..." interactive option is used in a Responsive layout or 60-40 page.

The interactive can also request to be a specific height. In this case the interactive width will be as wide as possible and the height will be the requested height. So this will override the window height limitation above.

pages.name: Full Width: Default aspect ratio, Info/Assessment block

embeddable.content:
The page layout is "Full Width".

The interactive on this page has an aspect ratio setting of "Default aspect ratio, ...".    And the interactive has been added to the Info/Assessment block section of the page.

In Full Width layout, this should behave the same as an interactive in the interactive box section of the page. This documented on the previous page.

pages.name: Full Width: Use all available space

embeddable.content:
The page layout is "Full Width".

The interactive on this page has an aspect ratio setting of "Use all available space". And the interactive has been added to the Interactive Box section of the page.

The interactive width will be the width of the page. The interactive height will be the height of the window.  The interactive height will update as the window is resized.

The interactive can also request to be a specific height. In this case the interactive width will be as wide as possible and the height will be the requested height.

The page layout is "Full Width". The interactive on this page has an aspect ratio setting of "Manual Aspect Ratio". And the interactive has been added to the Interactive Box section of the page.

The interactive will be as wide as the page. Most themes have a "Full Width" width of 936px. The height of the interactive will be this width divided by the manually entered aspect ratio. So normally this height will be 936/aspectRatio

The height of the interactive will not be limited based on the window height. So if your window is short you will not be able to see the full interactive.

The interactive can also request to be a specific height. In this case the interactive width will be as wide as possible and the height will be requested height.

pages.name: Responsive: Lab, use all available space

embeddable.content:
This tests the responsive layout, with the LARA linteractive aspect ratio of "use all available space".

The Lab interactive does its own scaling.

The interactive should not become 'unpinned'.

pages.name: Responsive: scaled CODAP, aspect ratio of the screen

embeddable.content:
The aspect ratio of the interactive should be the same as the screen's aspect ratio, you should see a fullscreen button, and the interactive should be scaled. This interactive should not become "unpinned".

Here is how it is configured:

The CODAP Interactive that is configured to be scaled. This is done using a URL parameter. CODAP has a UI for creating the interactive URL and has a check box to enable this scaling.

The LARA interactive aspect ratio is set to "default aspect ratio or set by interactive". This LARA setting means that LARA will respect the aspect ratio requested by the CODAP interactive.  When CODAP interactives are configured to be scaled, they request the aspect ratio of the computer screen. This way when they go full screen the user will see the same content that they see when the interactive is not fullscreen. 

LARA computes the actual size of the interactive using this requested aspect ratio and the available space to show the interactive. It finds the maxium size that will fit both vertically and horizontally in the available space while preserving the aspect ratio.

This includes a button to reset the students work below the interactive.

pages.name: Responsive: Teacher Edition, default aspect ratio

embeddable.content:
On this page the interactive has a teacher edition question wrapper.

To view the page in teacher edition this teacher edition link might work for you. If the link doesn't work, then add

?mode=teacher-edition

to the end of the url.

In this case the pinning (or stickiness) of the interactive is based on the teacher edition content plus the interactive. So if the combination of the two fits within the viewport height, then it will be pinned.

The height limiting of the interactive is based just on the interactive itself. So the wrapping content of the teacher edition is not used in this caculation. This way if an author adds many paragraphs of teacher edition content the interactive will still be the same size that it would without the teacher edition content.

In this specific case, the interactive is set to "default aspect ratio...". So it will try to remain at the 1.3 aspect ratio. If you make your window wide and short, and you show the teacher edition content, you should see how the interactive height is limitied by the viewport height. And with this window size and scroll position the teacher edition content will not be visible. 

We tried out a few options for handling this case. This option of ignoring the teacher edition wrapping content seemed to be the best option. If the teacher edition content is included in the sizing calculation and we try to fit it in the viewport height, then we have to resize the interactive.  So with with a large amount ot teacher edition content, the interactive will have to get really small which isn't desirable. So we settled on the relatively simple approach of just ignoring the teacher edition content in the sizing calculation. This has the caveat that the teacher edition content is still used in the pinning calculation.
